thread.title: Authorities serve search warrants across metro area in major drug investigation, police say
thread.title_full: Authorities serve search warrants across metro area in major drug investigation, police say | OregonLive.com

author: Rebecca Woolington | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Authorities serve search warrants across metro area in major drug investigation, police say
text:
Federal and local authorities served several search warrants in the metro area Thursday morning as part of a major drug investigation, according to Hillsboro Police.
Investigators started serving the warrants after 4 a.m. Thursday, said Lt. Mike Rouches, a Hillsboro Police spokesman. They were being served in connection with a meth investigation, he said.
Very few details have been released so far about the operation.
At least one search warrant was served in Hillsboro. The investigation involves both the Drug Enforcement Administration and Washington County's Westside Interagency Narcotics Team, Rouches said.
The Washington County drug team was the lead agency on the case, but worked with several law enforcement agencies to serve the warrants Thursday, said Sgt. Bob Ray, a sheriff's office spokesman. Investigators are finishing up their searches, interviews and evidence gathering Thursday afternoon.
Arrests were made, Ray said, but he didn't know how many.
This story will be updated as more information becomes available.
-- Rebecca Woolington
rwoolington@oregonian.com
503-294-4049; @rwoolington
